description: Acting & Improvisation classes focus specifically on building acting skills through acting and improvisation games and exercises. Students will develop/ present their own ideas, interpretations of their understanding of characteristics, behaviors, motives and how to apply those principles to a scripted scene or play. Classroom activities include developing a theme as a class, blocking and taking stage direction, scene study, and how to organize our own individual ideas when telling a story as a group with the end goal of getting those stories/ characters on their feet. Students learn to act serious, silly and everything in between. Each teaching artist will customize the class based on the abilities of the students enrolled.
name: PAA: Acting & Improv 3rd/4th/5th (Spring 2025)

description: Witness the birth of a nation in "1776": a revolutionary musical experience! Join John Adams, Thomas Jefferson, Ben Franklin and other iconic figures as they draft the Declaration of Independence. This Tony Award-winning musical is a gripping portrayal of some of the most pivotal moments in American history. "1776" is not just a musical; it's a captivating journey that brings history to life with stirring melodies and a patriotic spirit.

Ella, Nat, Frank, Pegg and Dean: A Big Band Bash! 
James Langton's New York All Star Big Band with special guests, Gimme Four.
Join us for a spectacular concert of big band swing songs! James Langton's New York All-Star BIg Band returns to Manasquan with a program of thrilling arrangements as performed by all-time greats like Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Dean Martin, Nat King Cole and Peggy Lee. Topping it off, the immaculate vocal harmonies of New Jersey's own Gimme Four
name: A Big Band Bash!

description: A Carole King Christmas is a celebration of the music and life of Carole King and her epic Christmas Album. Award-winning lead singer and piano prodigy Michelle Foster brings a vibrant and nuanced sound to the material you know and love along with her six-piece band. Come out for a reminiscent evening of simpler times and holiday joy with the entire family.
name: A Carole King Christmas

description: Gather your friends together and experience a night of Gordon Lightfoot's classic tunes performed by singer/songwriter Tom DiMenna. The concert will be packed with nostalgia, storytelling, and fun music. DiMenna's impressive vocal range and guitar style have been perfected with decades of stage performances. Now is your chance to see what all the buzz is about. The legend lives on!
name: A Tribute to Gordon Lightfoot

description: Join us for "An Afternoon at the Opera" with Father Alphonse's Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea in the enchanting world of opera as the orchestra brings to life the genre's greatest moments. This astonishing performance showcases the talents of the area's top opera singers, creating a captivating blend of orchestral passion and vocal prowess. We invite you to a memorable afternoon filled with soaring melodies and enduring masterpieces to close our 2024-2025 Orchestra Series.
name: An Afternoon at the Opera

description: Asbury Shorts is New York City's longest running exhibition of award-winning short films and producer Doug LeClaire brings the World's Best Short Films back the to Algonquin. Produced as a fast-paced event in a "Short Film Concert" format, the program features the best in comedy, drama and animation by combining classic shorts with new international festival winners. A rare opportunity to see world-class short films on the big screen in a theatrical setting.
name: Asbury Shorts World's Best Films

description: Asbury Shorts is New York City's longest running exhibition of award-winning short films and producer Doug LeClaire brings the World's Best Short Films back to the Algonquin. Produced as a fast-paced event in a "Short Film Concert" format, the program features the best in comedy, drama and animation by combining classic shorts with new international festival winners.
name: Asbury Shorts: World's Best Short Films

description: Winner of the Tony Triple Crown for Best Musical, Best Score, and Best Book, this laugh-out-loud musical - featuring actors and puppets - tells the story of recent college grad named Princeton, who moves into a shabby New York apartment on Avenue Q. He soon discovers that, although the residents seem nice, it's clear that it is not your ordinary neighborhood, which is racy, adults-only cross between South Park and Sesame Street.
name: Avenue Q

description: This show will take you on a journey through Burt Bacharach’s greatest songs and several surprises. Burt Bacharach, who is considered one of the most important composers of 20th-century popular music, composed hundreds of pop songs from the late 1950s through the 1980s, mostly in collaboration with lyricist Hal David. Travel back in time with us and experience this Bacharach tribute live on stage!
name: Back to Bacharach

description: Algonquin’s Annual Fundraising Bash brings Natural Wonder to the Manasquan stage for the first time. Make no mistake: Natural Wonder is the Ultimate Stevie Wonder Experience, an epic endeavor that brings real musicianship, a dynamic stage show, and a deep, studious love of the Stevie Wonder legacy to audiences who know that good, authentic music is. This Stevie Wonder Tribute featuring Gabriel Bello aims to capture the essence of Stevie Wonder, one of the greatest entertainers of the past half century, by presenting decades of hit after hit with masterful execution to make audiences feel as if they are at a concert with the legend himself.
name: BASH: Stevie Wonder Tribute

description: This international John Denver Tribute with the show’s captivating performance and stunning visuals of nature, Chris Collins and Boulder Canyon perform many of John Denver’s famous hits such as “Rocky Mountain High,” “Take Me Home,” “Country Roads,” “Annie’s Song,” “Sunshine,” and many others in an unforgettable concert in tribute to one of the greatest artists of our time.
name: BENEFIT: John Denver Tribute

description: Swing into the sound of jazz with Benny Goodman & The Kingdom of Swing! Cherish the legend, Benny Goodman’s timeless swing music, brought to life by New York's top jazz musicians, curated by James Langton. Don’t miss this high-energy concert of classic jazz hits live at the Algonquin.
name: Benny Goodman & the Kingdom of Swing

description: Join us for a spectacular evening of musical enchantment as Father Alphonse's Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea takes center stage at “The Best of Broadway Bash.” From showstoppers to heartwarming ballads, experience the essence of Broadway like never before. This fundraiser promises not only an extraordinary musical journey but also an opportunity to contribute to the cultural vibrancy of our community. Your attendance directly supports Algonquin Arts Theatre, ensuring that the magic of live performances continues to thrive. The evening will also honor Father Alphonse Stephenson (Conductor), Ann Marie Miller (Arts Advocate) and the Manasquan Chamber of Commerce. VIP tickets include a pre-show reception with an open bar and passed hors d'oeuvres.
name: Best of Broadway Bash

description:
Swingin’ with the King, the Count, the Duke and the Earl.
Embark on a musical journey through the ages with the soul-stirring sounds of jazz royalty, including the iconic “Duke” Ellington, the velvety Nat “King” Cole, the swinging “Count” Basie, the innovative “Earl” Hines, and Benny Goodman, the “King” of Swing. James Langton's New York All Stars Big Band takes center stage to kick off Algonquin’s 2024-2025 Jazz Series bringing these timeless melodies to life, delivering an authentic and electrifying performance.
name: Big Band Royalty

description:
Shuffle, Boogie and Swing featuring Gimme Four
Get ready to swing and shuffle your way into a stimulating conclusion of the 2024-2025 Jazz Series with "Boogie Woogie Big Band" featuring the sensational James Langton and his dynamic New York All Stars. From the irresistible beats of boogie-woogie to the timeless allure of swing and the fabulous vocal harmony of Gimme Four, this performance is a celebration of the vibrant music that defined an era. Get ready to dance, groove, and immerse yourself for an afternoon of musical brilliance that will leave you wanting more.
name: Boogie Woogie Big Band

description: Through a colorful tapestry of iconic songs and witty storytelling, Carter Calvert uses her own award-winning vocal talents to create this captivating musical tribute to legend Patsy Cline. Miss Calvert, a Broadway star and title character in Always…Patsy Cline, has gained rave reviews for her heartfelt portrayal of this legendary country recording artist. She vocally captures Cline’s musical stylings in mega-hits including “Crazy,” “I Fall To Pieces,” “She’s Got You” and “Walkin’ After Midnight.”
name: Carter Calvert - Walkin' After Midnight

description: Prepare for a purr-fectly mesmerizing performance of the world-renowned musical sensation - Cats! Andrew Lloyd Webber's masterpiece comes to life on stage with breathtaking choreography and dazzling costumes that have captivated audiences worldwide. Don't miss your chance to be part of this theatrical phenomenon. A 'Memory' that will linger long after the final curtain falls!
name: Cats

description: Join powerhouse vocalist Chris Pinnella for an afternoon of music honoring the legendary Tony Bennett. Expect to hear classic Tony hits like “I Left My Heart in San Francisco,” “Don't Get Around Much Anymore,” “Fly Me to the Moon,” and so many more! Pinnella will be backed by a stellar group of musicians, so get your tickets early for this concert celebrating one of the greatest singers EVER!
name: Chris Pinnella - Tony Bennett Tribute

description: Join powerhouse vocalist Chris Pinnella (formerly of Trans-Siberian Orchestra) with his 15-piece orchestra, complete with back-up singers and some very special guests as he returns to the Algonquin with his brand new show, "Unchained Melodies". Spanning decades, the orchestra will reimagine a variety of chart-topping artists including Neil Young, Guns and Roses, Billy Joel, led Zeppelin, Simon and Garfunkel, The Righteous Brothers, David Bowie and more.
name: Chris Pinnella's Unchained Melodies

description: Get ready to experience one of the most authentic tribute acts ever to hit the music scene as DAYBREAK “The Music & Passion of Barry Manilow” takes you on a musical journey back to the 70’s. Fans will experience Manilow’s greatest hits the way you remember them. Led by veteran musician and pianist Joe Hite, along with his 8-piece ensemble, DAYBREAK brings to life timeless classics like “Mandy,” “Can’t Smile Without You,” and the foot stomping rhythm of “Copacabana,” just to name a few.
name: Daybreak Live - Barry Manilow

description: Sidney Bruhl would do anything to publish his next great play. He would even kill for it. This dark comedy thriller will have audiences laughing one moment and screaming in terror the next as Sidney discovers he may not be the only murderer in the room. One of the great popular successes of recent Broadway history, Deathtrap provides twists and turns and sudden shocks in such abundance that audiences will be held spellbound until the very last moment.
name: Deathtrap

description: Back by popular demand! Based on the 2003 film, Elf-The Musical is the hilarious tale of Buddy, a young orphan child who mistakingly crawls into Santa's bag of gifts and is transported back to the North Pole. Unaware that he is actually human, Buddy embarks on a journey to New York City to find his birth father, discover his true identity, and help New York remember the true meaning of Christmas. This modern day Christmas classic is sure to make everyone embrace their inner ELF.
name: Elf - The Musical

description: Join us with Father Alphonse and his Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea to celebrate the new year in our annual concert curated by Father Alphonse Stephenson. Start 2024 with an inspiring performance by his world-class orchestra ensemble.
name: Father Alphonse's New Year 2024

description: Step into the magic of a musical journey as Father Alphonse's Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea presents "Father Alphonse's New Year 2025." Curated by the maestro himself, this annual performance is a celebration of the New Year like no other. Be captivated by the symphonic brilliance as the orchestra delivers a mesmerizing repertoire, weaving together timeless classics and contemporary gems to ring in 2025 in style. Cheers to a New Year filled with harmonious moments and joyous melodies!
name: Father Alphonse's New Year 2025

description: A journey of love, loss, faith, and family, Fiddler on the Roof is a celebration of life and all its challenges. The original production won ten Tony Awards, including a special Tony for becoming the longest-running Broadway musical of all time. Featuring the Broadway classics "Tradition," "If I Were a Rich Man," "Sunrise, Sunset," "Matchmaker, Matchmaker" and "To Life," Fiddler on the Roof will introduce a new generation to this uplifting celebration that raises its cup to joy! To love! To life!
name: Fiddler on the Roof

description: Join us for the ultimate dance sensation – "Footloose!" This explosive musical, based on the beloved '80s film, is set to take your breath away with its infectious energy and a story that will have you cheering for freedom! With a chart-topping soundtrack featuring hits like "Footloose," "Let's Hear It for the Boy," and "Holding Out for a Hero," this high-energy production will have you tapping your feet and singing along.
name: Footloose

description: Step into a winter wonderland of song, dance and holiday cheer with the timeless classic, Irving Berlin's "White Christmas". This heartwarming musical is ready to whisk you away on a nostalgic journey filled with dazzling performances, memorable tunes, and a touch of old-fashioned romance. Create lasting memories and traditions with loved ones as you revel in the magic of this beloved musical together.
name: FY25 White Christmas

description: There is NO OTHER Steely Dan Tribute that comes as close to recreating the meticulous sound of Steely Dan musically and vocally as Good Stuff! Good Stuff performs the music of Steely Dan, with additional material from Sting, Stevie Wonder and Gino Vannelli, all in the same show. It’s a perfect afternoon of top notch entertainment.
name: Good Stuff: Steely Dan Tribute

description: It's STILL the word! One of the world's favorite musicals hits the stage in a high-octane production featuring all the hit songs you love, including: "Summer Nights," "You're the One That I Want," "Hopelessly Devoted to You" and "Greased Lightning." Danny, Sandy and the coolest gang of students from Rydell High take you back to the 1950's when drive-in movies, sock-hops and tough talkin' Pink Ladies defined a generation. So get ready to hand-jive the night away with this electrifyin' musical that will make you want to stand up and shout, "A-wop-bop-a-loo-bop A-wop-bam-boom!"
name: Grease

description: Get ready for a musical extravaganza that will dazzle your senses and ignite your imagination. Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat is a vibrant and joyous spectacle that brings the tale of Joseph and his brothers on their rollicking adventure, filled with laughter, love, and unexpected twists. Bring the entire family to witness this magnificent array of colors, music and pure theatrical magic!
htmlDescription:
Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat

October 11 - October 20, 2024
name: Joseph...Dreamcoat

description:
"THE WORLD'S GREATEST MUSICAL IMPERSONATION SHOW!"
Neil Diamond * Willie Nelson * The Beach Boys * The Beatles * Billy Joel * Buddy Holly * The Eagles * The Bee Gees * The Everly Brothers * Rick Nelson * Jerry Lee Lewis * Roy Orbison * John Fogerty & Creedence Clearwater Revival * Garth Brooks * Jimmy Buffett * The Byrds * Buffalo Springfield * Crosby Stills Nash & Young * Steve Miller Band * & More!
name: Jukebox Heroes - Mahoney Brothers

description: Celebrate the legacy of jazz legend Duke Ellington with Kinda Dukish, a tribute concert featuring James Langton's New York All Star Band. Experience the timeless sounds of Ellington’s greatest hits, brought to life by top-tier jazz musicians in an unforgettable performance.
name: Kinda Dukish-Tribute to Duke Ellington

description:
Lecture & Screening by Doug LeClaire, Founder & Director of Asbury Shorts USA

Join award-winning producer Doug LeClaire for an entertaining and insightful journey through his career in national TV commercials, independent short films, and his acclaimed Asbury Shorts USA exhibition. With over 40 years of experience, Doug will share behind-the-scenes stories and showcase some of the most celebrated short films from around the world, offering a unique perspective on life through film.

Recommended: Attend the screening of "World’s Best Short Films" at Algonquin Arts Theatre on March 8, 2025, before this class!
name: LL: An Outlandish Trip through Life in Film (FY25)

description:
Explore the powerful storytelling of The Diary of Anne Frank with Algonquin Arts Theatre Stage Director Gina Lupi. This engaging session will delve into the artistic choices and staging techniques that bring Anne Frank’s story to life, creating an immersive experience that resonates deeply with audiences. Through a staged illustration, you will gain a unique perspective on how the play makes Anne Frank’s journey feel more personal and real.

Bonus: Don’t miss “The Diary of Anne Frank” on the Algonquin stage in February 2025!
name: LL: Anne Frank on Stage: Analyzing the Effectiveness of the Play (FY25)

description:
Discover the timeless story of Joseph & The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat, an enchanting musical that blends humor, drama, and vibrant music to retell the tale of Joseph. Join Stage Director, Anthony Greco to delve into the rich themes, memorable characters, and the colorful brilliance behind this Andrew Lloyd Webber and Time Rice classic. 

Bonus: Joseph & The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat coming to the Algonquin stage October 2024
name: LL: Draw Back the Curtain, Any Dream Will Do (FY25)

description:
Discover one of the greatest comeback stories in entertainment history—Frank Sinatra's remarkable journey in the 1950s. After facing career setbacks, personal heartbreak, and a struggling voice, Sinatra defied the odds, earning an Academy Award and creating legendary recordings for Capitol Records. Join Sinatra expert Ricky Riccardi for a captivating presentation filled with rare videos and audio clips showcasing Sinatra's iconic performances.

Bonus: Experience the golden era of jazz live with "Perfectly Frank" featuring James Langton’s New York All-Star Big Band at Algonquin Arts Theatre on November 10, 2024!
name: LL: Frank Sinatra in the 1950’s (FY25)

description:
Step back into the golden age of Swing! Between 1935 and 1945, America danced to the rhythm of big bands, with bandleaders like Duke Ellington, Count Basie, and Benny Goodman reigning as music royalty. Join swing expert Ricky Riccardi for an engaging multimedia presentation filled with rare videos and photos that capture the magic of the Swing Era.

Bonus: Don’t miss "Swingin' with the King, the Count, the Duke, and the Earl" featuring James Langton’s New York All-Star Big Band at Algonquin Arts Theatre on August 25, 2024!
name: LL: Kings of Swing (FY25)

description:
Get ready to cut loose as Footloose hits the stage at Algonquin Arts Theatre, under the direction of Gina Lupi. This class dives into the cultural impact of one of the most iconic movie musicals, celebrating the importance of listening to young voices and guiding them with compassion. Explore the themes of the musical and its unforgettable pop hits like "Footloose," "Let's Hear It for the Boy," and "Holding Out for a Hero."

Bonus: Don’t miss “Footloose” live on stage at Algonquin Arts Theatre, March – April 2025!
name: LL: Lessons in Pop Culture: Footloose (FY25)

description:
Join Father Alphonse Stephenson, conductor of the Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea, for an inspiring journey through the world of opera. In this engaging discussion, Father Alphonse will share his passion for the art form and offer a glimpse into some of opera's most powerful and moving moments—just in time for the upcoming concert on April 27.

Bonus: Experience "An Afternoon at The Opera," part of the Orchestra Series on the Algonquin stage in April 2025!
name: LL: Music with the Maestro (FY25)

description: Made popular by the Kathy Bates, James Caan film, Misery becomes stranger than fiction when an acclaimed romance novelist wakes up in the home of his "Number One Fan." Rescued from a wintery car crash, Paul Sheldon finds himself incapacitated in the secluded home of Annie Wilkes, a seemingly kind nurse. When events take a nightmarish turn, the injured Paul realizes the unhinged Annie has no intention of letting him leave. Based on Stephen King's best-selling novel, the tense cat-and-mouse game will grip you until the very end.
name: Misery

description: Bring in 2024 at the Algonquin with Beginnings, the ultimate tribute to the music of super-group Chicago.  Performing in Chicago's original, classic-era 7pc. configuration, Beginnings delivers the world's most authentic live Chicago concert experience, bringing the legendary band's extensive catalog to life, with stunning detail, accuracy, and intensity. Fueled by world class musicianship and a passion for performance, the band is a live music experience not to be missed.
name: NYE - Beginnings - Chicago

description: Bring in the New Year at the Algonquin with Tusk, the number one Tribute to Fleetwood Mac in the world, bar none. No fancy tricks, no gimmicks, just five musicians recreating the music of Fleetwood Mac to perfection with note for note renditions that no other Fleetwood Mac tribute on the touring scene today can come close to duplicating.
name: NYE: Tusk: Fleetwood Mac Tribute

description: Father Alphonse and his Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea take us on a journey celebrating the best that opera has to offer. Opera singing sensations will join the orchestra to bring some of your favorite arias and choruses to life. No need for opera glasses with this intimate concert!
name: Opera's Greatest Hits

description: Our Musical Theatre classes fold singing, dancing and acting. The class review musical theatre dance/ movement, group and individual vocal singing development and developing well known musical Theatre characters. Classroom activities include vocal warm-ups, scene study, and more. Teaching artist will customize the class based on the level and abilities of the students enrolled.
name: PAA: (Monday) Musical Theatre 3rd/4th/5th (Fall 2024)

description: Our Musical Theatre classes fold singing, dancing and acting. The class review musical theatre dance/ movement, group and individual vocal singing development and developing well-known musical Theatre characters. Classroom activities include vocal warm-ups, scene study, and more. Teaching artist will customize the class based on the level and abilities of the students enrolled.
name: PAA: (Monday) Musical Theatre 3rd/4th/5th (Spring 2025)

description: Students will study, observe, rehearse and perform modern scenes from plays. Explore the history and the making of a play by rehearsing scripted scenes from various playwrights and participate in a creative discussion from the perspective of a director vs. the actor. Participate in an ensemble reading of the script to be presented on the last day of class. No experience necessary.
name: PAA: Acting & Improv 6th/7th/8th (Fall 2024)

Students learn to act serious, silly and everything in between. Teaching artist will customize the class based on the abilities of the students enrolled.

Classes will explore musical theatre dance/ movement, group and individual vocal singing and interpreting theatrical characters. Classroom activities include vocal warm-ups, scene study, and more. Teaching artist will customize the class based on the level and abilities of the students enrolled.

description: This class will introduce students to the fundamentals of theatre through games, stories, songs and movement. This a great chance for an introduction to the theatre.
name: PAA: Musical Theatre 1st & 2nd (Fall 2024)

description: Algonquin's Teen Night is a program for the playwrights, future directors, designers, performers as well as theatregoers. Students will participate in a free-of-charge viewing of Algonquin Arts Theater's main stage performances throughout the 2024 – 2025 performance season. Each performance viewing will incorporate a meet and greet and Q & A with the productions creative team. Teen Night will view, read, share, and discuss theatrical performances as a class. (Must be available for all four session before registering).
name: PAA: TEEN NIGHT (FY25)

description: For students who just completed or will be entering Kindergarten in the fall, this class provides a broad introduction to theatre through age-appropriate games, stories, songs and movement. This a great chance for an introduction to the theatre.
name: PAA:V: Intro to Theatre K-1st (Aug 12 -16) Summer 2024

description: For students who just completed or will be entering Kindergarten in the fall, this class provides a broad introduction to theatre through age-appropriate games, stories, songs and movement. This a great chance for an introduction to the theatre.
name: PAA:V: Intro to Theatre K-1st (Aug 19 - 23) Summer 2024

description: Join us for two, one-act operas with Father Alphonse and his Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea. Dazzling vocalists will perform CAVALLERIA RUSTICANA and PAGLIACCI with orchestra.
name: Pagliacci and Cavalleria Rusticana

description: One of the greatest R&B, Pop, Soul and Dance bands of all time - Earth, Wind & Fire - is being honored by ParkwaySoul. This Earth, Wind & Fire Tribute Band is a talented and committed group of musicians and vocalists who perform powerful renditions of all of Earth, Wind & Fire's top hits, including “September,” “Let's Groove,” “Boogie Wonderland,” “Sing a Song,” “Shining Star” and more!
name: Parkway Soul - Earth, Wind & Fire

description:
Frank Sinatra’s Radio “Symphonette” of the 1950’s
Step back in time to the golden era of jazz with "Perfectly Frank" – a mesmerizing performance that pays homage to the legendary Frank Sinatra's small band “Symphonette” with which he made iconic radio appearances in the 1950s and ‘60s. Join us for a night of nostalgia, sophistication, and the magic of Sinatra. James Langton hand picks some of the tri-state areas top musicians for this special event. "Perfectly Frank" is not just a concert; it's a journey into the heart of swing and the enduring legacy of one of music's greatest icons.
name: Perfectly Frank

description: The groovy blue cat that sees life as an adventure no matter where you wind up, the minute Pete walks in the door, he gets the whole family rocking.
name: Pete The Cat (EduFY25)

description: Don’t miss Kenny & Dolly Together Again starring Wendy T and Marty Edwards. The show recreates the magic of Dolly Parton and Kenny Rogers, as these two seasoned artists deliver the incredible songs and the onstage playfulness of Kenny & Dolly's "Real Love" tour. This tribute act has it all...the songs, the mannerisms, the vocals and of course, the charm, and energy of Kenny & Dolly.
name: Real Love: Kenny & Dolly Tribute

description: The John Rodgers Soul Band presents Rock the Yacht with breezy vocals, and bouncy rhythms—all elements that evoke a relaxing bay cruise on the Algonquin Stage this August. From Steely Dan to groups like the Doobie Brothers and Toto, Rock the Yacht showcases the soft rock that dominated FM radio airwaves in the late 1970s and early 1980s.
name: Rock the Yacht!

description: Back by popular demand, Ronstadt Revue covers every aspect of Linda Ronstadt's musical journey, spanning multiple genres from Country, Rock, to Mexican/Mariachi, Cajun, Jazz & the Great American Songbook Standards. All of this is faithfully recreated in painstaking detail by Gesenia and her six-piece band of musicians. This show will sell out. Don’t wait!
name: Ronstadt Revue

description: James Langton presents a stellar ensemble of some of New York's finest musicians in his toe-tapping, heart-warming celebration of jazz legend Louis Armstrong. Featuring the brilliant Mike Davis on trumpet and boasting a line-up including award-winners Rossano Sportiello (piano), Dan Levinson (clarinet), Jim Fryer (trombone), Conal Fowkes (bass) and Kevin Dorn (drums), we can guarantee there'll be a hot time in the old town tonight!
name: Satchmo! Celebrating Louis Armstrong

description: Broadway, TV, and Film star, Robert Neary, creates a one-of-a-kind tribute to one of the greatest recording artists in history. This tribute show to Neil Diamond is unlike any you have ever seen or heard before. You will swear you are watching the master, himself, as Robert tells the stories behind some of the classic songs and performs 22 of Neil’s greatest h its. Backed by NYC’s premier band, The Mystic, So Good! The Neil Diamond Experience is guaranteed to leave you cheering and wanting more.
name: So Good - Neil Diamond

description: Step into a world where the vibrancy of youth clashes with the oppressive constraints of society - Spring Awakening, the groundbreaking musical with a soul-stirring score by Duncan Sheik and a Tony Award-winning book by Steven Sater. The musical's fusion of rock and folk music perfectly compliment the poignant narrative of love, rebellion, and self-discovery. FOR MATURE AUDIENCES ONLY.
name: Spring Awakening

description: Join James Langton’s New York All-Star Band and vocal group Gimme Four for an unforgettable afternoon of jazz and holiday cheer. This festive concert will have you tapping your toes to classic tunes and winter favorites. Bring the whole family to get “in the mood” this holiday season.
name: Swingin' in a Winter Wonderland

description: The country’s premier Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers tribute band. This band was established to let the fans of the late great Tom Petty continue to enjoy the live experience. Unlike the vast amount of Tom Petty tributes who substitute visual mimicry for sound, the Breakers encompass the true unmistakable sound and execution of Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers
name: The Breakers - Tom Petty Tribute

description: Embark on a poignant journey through history with one of the most powerful and enduring stories of resilience, family, hope and the human spirit. Anne Frank's eloquent and deeply moving words leap from the pages of her diary to the stage. "The Diary of Anne Frank" remains a relevant exploration of the impact of war, intolerance, and the importance of empathy, understanding, and the pursuit of a better world.
htmlDescription:
The Diary of Anne Frank

February 15 - February 22, 2025
name: The Diary of Anne Frank

description: Embark on a musical odyssey with Father Alphonse's Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea at the Algonquin as they present "The Great American Songbook" to kick off the 2024-2025 Orchestra Series. Immerse yourself in the timeless allure of a cherished collection of enduring and influential American popular songs and jazz standards that have left an indelible mark on the country's musical landscape skillfully performed by this acclaimed orchestra under the guidance of Father Alphonse Stephenson.
name: The Great American Songbook

description: The Great Gatsby is considered to be one of the great American novels, this performance features a solo-performance of the privilege and pitfalls each character encounters as they each reach for their own “green light.”
name: The Great Gatsby (EduFY25)

description: Based on the Victor Hugo novel and the songs from the Disney animated feature, The Hunchback of Notre Dame showcases the film's Academy Award-nominated score, plus new songs written for the stage. The show's bold theatrics combined with the musics's orchestral and choral power, promise to transport audiences back to fifteenth century Paris and inside the walls of the world's most famous cathedral with Quasimodo, Esmeralda & Claude Frollo. This powerful and timeless tale of love and heroism, coming in the least expected forms, will have audiences mesmerized by the magic of this truly unforgettable musical.
name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame

description: The life and story of Dr. Martin Luther King, one of history’s most influential Civil Rights leaders.
name: The Life of Dr. King (EduFY25)

description: The story of young Percy Jackson, a troubled 12-year-old boy with a secret unknown even to himself.
name: The Lightning Thief (EduFY25)

description: Father Alphonse and his Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea sweep us off our feet with an afternoon of orchestra music that inspires dance. From the ballet to Broadway, this award-winning orchestra will have you humming along, tapping your feet and standing for an ovation.
name: The Music That Makes Me Dance

description: Based on Marcus Pfister’s bestselling children’s book, The Rainbow Fish is an enchanting musical about the importance of sharing. Rainbow Fish, the most beautiful fish in the sea, learns a valuable lesson when her friends ask for some of her silver scales.
name: The Rainbow Fish (EduFY25)

description: Join Maria, Captain Von Trapp and his children in one of the most beloved musicals of all time, The Sound of Music. This classic has enchanted audiences for more than 50 years, featuring a trove of cherished songs, including "Climb Ev'ry Mountain," "My Favorite Things," "Do, Re, Mi," "Sixteen Going on Seventeen." The Sound of Music has won the hearts of audiences worldwide, earning five Tony Awards and five Oscars.
name: The Sound of Music

description: The courage of Anne Frank, and her family, is the story of the strength of the human spirit in the most challenging times.
name: The Story of Anne Frank (EduFY25)

description:
Artie Shaw and Bennie Goodman
James Langton presents The New York All-Stars featuring Dan Levinson with a program of swing classics that will have all the cats jitterbugging in the aisles! Artie Shaw and Bennie Goodman both tootled their clarinets in front of legendary big bands, playing hits like "Begin in the Beguine" and "Sing Sing Sing" but they saves some of their best music for their small groups. Shaw's Gramercy 5 had huge hits with tunes like "Smoke Gets In Your Eyes". Goodman's trio, quartet and sextet cut classics like "Airmail Special" and "Stompin' At the Savoy". Join us for a swingin' stroll down memory lane!
name: The Swinging Small Groups

description: A tribute to Rock Musicals from the 1970's - present, Theatre Rock LIVE! brings the greatest hits of this genre to Algonquin Arts Theatre with seasoned Broadway professionals. Featuring songs from Jersey Boys, Dear Evan Hanson, Rent, Pippin, Jagged Little Pill, Hair, Rocky Horror Picture Show, Mean Girls, The Who’s Tommy, Wicked and more.
name: Theatre Rock Live!

description:
Lewis-Presley-Cash-Perkins-Orbison: An Evening of Honkey Tonk and Bourbon
Travis Ledoyt brings together the artists of Sun Records: Presley, Cash, Orbison, Lewis, Perkins and more in this one night only fundraising concert at Algonquin Arts Theatre. Hear the hits that made these legends who they are in a truly engaging performance. Travis' musical abilities shine as he strums that guitar to "Folsom Prison" and pounds on the piano to "Great Balls of Fire!". This concert will have a VIP option that includes open bar.
name: Travis Ledoyt's Sun and the Stars

description: Join Winnie-the-Pooh and friends in the Hundred Acre Wood as they follow their imaginations to find adventure.
name: Winnie-The-Pooh (EduFY25)

description: Rediscover the magic of childhood with Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Lucy, Linus, Sally and the rest of the gang. "You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown" brings to life the timeless stories that have captured the hearts of audiences for generations. Charlie Brown's trials and triumphs, Lucy's unreliable wisdom, Sally's stubborn approach and Snoopy's imaginative adventures are sure to leave you with a smile on your face in this laugh-out-loud musical.
htmlDescription:
You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown

January 18 - January 26, 2025
name: You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown

description: Zack Alexander is a Jazz vocalist who specializes in the style of Frank Sinatra and The Rat Pack.  As the winner of the 2016 ‘Sinatra Idol’ competition in Hoboken, he is dedicated to bringing the Great American Songbook to life for current and future generations. Zack’s entertaining performances are heard at a wide variety of venues throughout the region. Zack and his 11-piece swing band will have audiences swooning at the Algonquin.
name: Zack Alexander
